root.name: RabbitJack's Casino
root.description: RabbitJack's Casino consisted of four games: stud poker, blackjack, bingo, and a slot machine. The idea was originally conceived by Rob Fulop, and the client software was programmed by him for the Commodore 64, which was the machine for which the Quantum Link network was designed. When Quantum Computer Services later initiated the Applelink Personal Edition network for the Apple II, and the PC-Link network for the IBM PC and clones, Fulop's company wrote the client software for each of those machines as well.
